It’s much more peppery and sturdy than what you’ll find at the supermarket. For an over-the-top dinner menu, serve this salad with Romano bean salad, paccheri with shellfish, grilled red mullet, grilled bistecca, and brioche au rhum. We said over-the-top.Ingredients8 servings16Italian plums, halved, or 8 small plums, quartered⅓cup cocktail onions, halved,layers separated2Tbsp. fresh lemon juice2Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling3oz. arugula (about 5 cups)Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper3oz. Parmesan, thinly slicedPreparationToss plums, cocktail onions, lemon juice, and 2 Tbsp. oil in a large bowl. Add arugula, season with salt and pepper, and toss again.
